<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Find the next appropriate location.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal">      End = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/memprof/#abee3ddc7c6eb611a3b96fb69489c81caaa6122a65eaa676f700ae68d393054a37">Start</a> + Obj.Size;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;  Overlaps. <Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/safestack/stacklayout/#a1f96a1519b9c38368a328cea96e449fb"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/safestack/stacklayout/#a1f96a1519b9c38368a328cea96e449fb">StackLayout::computeLayout</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Simple greedy algorithm.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this is replaced with something smarter, it must preserve the property</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that the first object is always at the offset 0 in the stack frame (for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// StackProtectorSlot), or handle stack protector in some other way.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sort objects by size (largest first) to reduce fragmentation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (StackObjects.size() &gt; 2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
